articles.author: Jenny Leonard, Alberto Nardelli, Eric Martin, Ott Tammik
articles.title: US Urged Europeans to Oppose EU Plan for Loan to Support Ukraine - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: The US lobbied several countries in the European Union in an effort to block EU plans to use frozen Russian central bank assets to back a massive loan to Ukraine, according to European diplomats familiar with the matter.

articles.title: US, European Stock Futures Rise Ahead of PCE Data: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg
articles.description: The S&P 500 is set to continue its advance toward a new all-time high as the prospect of interest-rate cuts and confidence in the economy fuel investors’ appetite for risk.

articles.title: Eurovision in turmoil as countries stage boycott over Israel’s place in contest - politico.eu
articles.description: Broadcasters from multiple European countries officially announce they won’t take part in next year’s music festival.

articles.author: Kristina Killgrove
articles.title: Volcanic eruption triggered 'butterfly effect' that led to the Black Death, researchers find - Live Science
articles.description: A volcanic eruption in 1345 may have kicked off a series of events that led to the Black Death sweeping through medieval Europe.
articles.content:
An unknown volcanic eruption in the mid-14th century may have set the stage for the spread of the Black Death
